dialogues.speaker: DR. HATCHER JOYCE COOPER
dialogues.text: -the dodgers, the bodgers- -the hawkers, the stalkers-

dialogues.speaker: ROY PORTER MARY PORTER
dialogues.text: -the gypsies, the tramps- -and thieves-

dialogues.speaker: ANNETTE ROPER
dialogues.text: -the paedophiles, the perverts-

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, you’ve had them.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: The adjudicators arrive tomorrow Nicholas. They were supposed to arrive in a couple of months but they brought it forward for some reason. We had to make sure everything was ready.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Are you saying this was all about winning the ’Best Village Award’?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: This is the best village Nicholas. You’ve seen the people. They’re happy, contented. Most of them don’t even know about our work. They have very normal lives. There’s a murmur of "very normal".

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: They’re living in a dream world.  122.

dialogues.speaker: HATCHER
dialogues.text: Precisely. No crime. No tension.

dialogues.speaker: WEAVER
dialogues.text: Sheer bliss. There’s a murmur of "bliss".

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We have created the society you dream about. Isn’t that worth preserving?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Not with murder.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sgt. Popwell thought much the same as you. I’m disappointed you can’t see the big picture.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Well, I’m happy to disappoint sir. And I’m afraid you’re going to have to come with me. You’re all going to have to come with me.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No Nicholas, I’m afraid it’s you who has to some with us... The NWA reveal an array of weapons from under their cloak axes, scythes, pitchforks, knives etc. Out of the shadows, a bruised and angry LURCH slaps a han on ANGEL’s shoulder. ANGEL is shocked. Another hand lands his other shoulder. he turns to see-

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Danny? No! NO! DANNY is silent. He and LURCH wield knives and torches. W lightning speed ANGEL ducks out of their grip, grabs LURC blade, spins behind DANNY and holds it to his throat. He takes DANNY’s torch and shines it at the NWA. ANGEL (cont’d) Now back off or you’1l be explaining to everyone how Danny accidentally tripped and cut his own head off. The NWA continue to close in. FRANK laughs.  123.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Oh come on Nicholas. You haven’t got it in you.

dialogues.speaker: I MEAN IT.
dialogues.text: They close in further. Shit. ANGEL throws DANNY to the ground and runs into the woods. The NWA give chase. A hoard of cloaked figures run throug the trees. ANGEL sprints into the darkhess- Suddenly ANGEL trips and falls through a hole in the path

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGEL crashes to a dusty [U+FB02]oor, winded. He picks up torch and shines it around. He seems to be inside an old GYPSY CARAVAN buried in the ground. His torch picks out a SKELETON IN GYPSY CLOTHING. ANGEL backs up frantically, colliding with an ENTIRE FAMI OF GYPSY SKELETONS, complete with children and dog. ANGEL staggers to the door which bursts open into a cave. His torch picks out many more bodies. The most recent addition, in a PURPLE SHELL SUIT is a dead PETER COCKER. ANGEL jumps back and finds himself staring at a skeleton a police sergeant’s uniform. It has a BIG BUSHY BEARD. ANGEL [U+FB02]ees the cave and sees one other corpse; tha the LIVING STATUE, now frozen in a final expression of terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGEL slams straight into DANNY at the cave mouth. The other NWA members gather behind, an ominous mass of shadow. DANNY produces his blade.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Danny! No! DANNY plunges the knife into ANGEL’s chest. We see ANGEL stagger back. His torch drops and smashes.  124. INT/EXT. DANNY’S CAR - NIGHT A sign looms in the night - ’YOU ARE NOW LEAVING SANDFORD A grim DANNY pulls into a dark layby in his Astra. The br lights illuminate the sign with a hellish glow. INT/EXT DANNY’S CAR - NIGHT A car boot opens. DANNY stands over a bloodied ANGEL, the knife protruding from his chest. ANGEL slowly opens his eyes and looks at DANNY with confusion. DANNY slowly opens his hand to reveal a number empty ketchup sachets.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (weakly) Ta-daaaa. DANNY yanks the knife out of ANGEL’s chest. ANGEL produce the notebook from his breast pocket.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: They told me I had to put you in the front seat and push you in the gorge. DANNY hauls ANGEL out of the car boot.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Danny, it’s murder.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It’s not, it’s ketchup.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I’m not talking about me Danny, I’m talking about all the others the NWA have murdered.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: That’s not true. Dad just said it’s his special club. I thought it was just about rapping knuckles and sending them on their way.  125.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: There are skeletons back there Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I don’t know nuffin about the skelingtons!

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: But what about Draper, Blower, Merchant, Messenger and Tiller? What do you think was happening?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: It was Frank, Danny. He’s appointed himself judge, jury and executioner.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: He’s not Judge Judy!

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: He is Danny! And you have to help me take him down.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I can’t Nicholas. I’m involved now. I have to do what Dad says. I can’t get out. But you can. Take the car go back to London. There’s nothing you can do.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I can come back. And I can bring the blue fury of the Metropolitan Police Service with me.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: They’11 make it all disappear. They hid it from everyone else. Who are they gonna believe? Dad, or the loony London copper?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: But you’1l be here won’t you Danny? We can do this together. You and me. Partners.  126.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Forget it Nicholas. It’s Sandford. A tearful DANNY pulls out his car keys. ANGEL takes them, limps to the car and drives off. In his rear view, ANGEL just make out the figure of DANNY standing in the road. INT. DANNY’S CAR - NIGHT ANGEL drives down the M4. Rain lashes his windscreen. His fuel light blinks low. He reaches ’HESTON SERVICES’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLERK eyes ANGEL, who is covered in grime and ketchup.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Is that everything Sir? ANGEL’s gaze has been drawn to a bargain bin full of DVDs He scans the titles - ’OUT FOR JUSTICE’, ’THE ENFDRCER’, ‘LETHAL WEAPON’, ‘WALKING TALL’, ’HARD TO KILL’. CLERK (cont’d) Sir? Sir? Is there anything we can do for you?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: No. This is something I have to do myself. ANGEL grabs a pair of shades, a [U+FB02]stful of car spra paints and some bubble gum. He slams down some crumpled money. EXT. BRANNIGAN’S FARM - MORNING We see the ‘WELCOME TO SANDFORD’ sign. It’s morning outside JAMES REAPER’s farm. His GREEN 4X4 pulls over to the roadside. He gets out and walks to some horses at a gate. They snort, restless. REAPER looks behi him. The ASTRA is sitting right in the middle of the road

dialogues.speaker: REAPER
dialogues.text: Danny? REAPER squints. It’s not DANNY. Sitting behind the wheel, wearing shades and revving the engine, is ANGEL.  127. Reaper runs to his 4X4...ANGEL screams towards him...Reap grabs his car radio.. SMASH. ANGEL crashes his car directly into the 4X4...REAP is left clutching the radio and snapped cable...ANGEL springs from the ASTRA and charges towards REAPER. REAPER (cont’d) Mum!!! ANGEL punches REAPER out cold. BANG...Buckshot rips into 4X4 next to ANGEL’s head... REAPER’S MUM brandishes a shotgun from the other side of gate. She breaks the shotgun and goes to reload. ANGEL runs towards the gate, jumps into the air and launc into a [U+FB02]ying kick. REAPER’S MUM snaps the shotgun shut, ANGEL lands on her, with maximum force. EXT. BRANNIGAN’S FARM - MORNING JAMES REAFER and his MUM are tied to the fence.

dialogues.speaker: REAPER
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? Just walk in and arrest the whole village?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGEL glides through the quiet front office, past the straight haired DESK SERGEANT who barely looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGEL glides through the locker room. No-one spots him. H opens his locker, and retrieves a uniform and a stab vest

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. EVIDENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: '999’ is punched into the keypad. The door opens on the arsenal of weaponry. ANGEL grabs all he can carry. RIFLES and SHOTGUNS round his shoulders, PISTOLS in his belt. The room is now completely empty, save for the sea mine.  128. INT. FRANK’S OFFICE - MORNING FRANK looks at paperwork and eats ice cream. In the outer office ANGEL stands looking in. FRANK becomes aware of someone watching. He looks up but ANGEL has gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGEL glides past the DESK SERGEANT, who finally pipes up

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Oh Sergeant Angel? Someone from London called for you. ANGEL scowls back at him, chewing gum, armed to the teeth DESK SERGEANT (cont'd) I’11 tell them you’1l1 ring ’em back. ANGEL nods and walks out. The DESK SERGEANT watches him g DESK SERGEANT (cont'd) That’s funny.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: I didn’t know we had a mounted division. The voice’s owner joins DESK SERGEANT in peering after ANGEL. It’s his curly haired twin brother.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Nobody tells me nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An armed ANGEL trots down the street on a FUCKING HORSE. rides past a bus shelter where GABRIEL WEAVER and the HOODIES sit in their usual formation, albeit in school uniform. They stare at ANGEL, their young mouths agape.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Wanna do something useful? ANGEL throws a holdall to GABRIEL. It’s full of spray can  129.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEAVER reads the paper and daintily eats ice cream. He do not see the CCTV screens slowly turn black behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandford. As it was that first morning. Idyllic, bustling happy. Among the morning folk we see smiling NWA members going about their business as if nothing has happened. We see WORKMEN putting up a banner across the middle of t street reading ’GOOD LUCK SANDFORD: VILLAGE OE THE YEAR’. ANNETTE ROPER is putting out a display in front of her sh Her walkie-talkie crackles to life.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE
dialogues.text: Annette, that new policeman’s back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEAVER hears this RADIO message and finally realises that all his precious CCTV cameras have been sprayed black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. HATCHER peers through his surgery window, his eyes wi ANGEL is re[U+FB02]ected passing on horse back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE COOPER waters the hanging baskets outside the hotel she spots ANGEL riding up the middle of the high street. The PORTERS peer out of the Crown, mouths agape. REV. SHOOTER is talking to the understudies GREG and SHER All three stop and stare. AMANDA PAVER skids to a stop on her bicycle and gawps. MR. TREACHER in his heavy coat loo on in terror. SKINNER and his staff stare from the window of SUMMERAISL DANNY is sat in the squad car in the usual parking spot. sees ANGEL and is terrified, not knowing what to do.  130.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEAVER bursts into FRANK’s office, panic stricken. FRANK looks up. His cheery expression dissipates immediately.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The village has come to a stop. The NWA watch as ANGEL dismounts. Beads of sweat glisten. Eyes [U+FB02]ick this and that. The ordinary folk are unnerved by the hush.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Morning. MR. TREACHER [U+FB02]ings open his winter coat revealing shot gun. ANGEL dives behind the fountain just as he fire The village erupts into chaos. The innocent run for cover The NWA mobilise. The PORTERS scurry inside. DR. HATCHER emerges from his surgery with a number of guns. ANNETTE ROPER runs into her shop. Moments later an upper window smashes and the barrel of a gun protrudes. DANNY sits in the car, his face a mixture of awe and pani ANGEL takes a look at MR. TREACHER’s position. He is standing next to a truck loaded with BEER BARRELS. ANGEL jumps up and fires blasting the catch holding the BEER BARRELS in place. They tumble off the back of the truck knocking TREACHER off his feet. ANGEL is pinned down by fire from ANNETTE ROPER. He looks to see ROPER’S gun poking out of her shop. ANGEL sees the HOODIES hiding behind a car. He motions to the newsagent. The HOODIES stampede into the shop. The do slams. We see the notice; "ONLY ONE CHILD AT ANY TIME". In the window, ROPER’S gun is suddenly yanked backwards. hear muffied screams and blows. Shots ring out, a hail of bullets narrowly missing ANGEL. Pedalling towards him on her cycle, firing a ri[U+FBO2]e AMANDA PAVER. ANGEL dives out of the line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY sees AMANDA PAVER in his wing mirror. His face hardens. He [U+FB02]ings the door wide open and sends AMA PAVER [U+FB02]ying through the air into a crumpled heap.  131. DANNY runs over to join ANGEL. ANGEL throws him a shotgun DANNY catches it in mid air. ANGEL (cont’d) That’s what I’m talking about. Shots ricochet off the fountain. GREG and SHEREE reign fi on the two officers. ANGEL and DANNY, without a moments pause, return fire, shooting GREG in his gun hand and SHE in the shoulder. Both fall dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE COOPER
dialogues.text: Fascist! JOYCE COOPER opens fire with an antique Winchester. DANNY dives for cover. ANGEL rolls across the [U+FBO2]oor, pull two pistols from his belt, still rolling he fires at JOYC One of JOYCE’s hanging baskets drops directly on her head

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Hag! There’s a piercing yell. ANGEL turns to see BERNARD barin down fast with the ORNAMENTAL SWORD. ANGEL barely manages draw his baton to block the attack. BERNARD swipes, slici the baton in half. ANGEL takes out BERNARD’s legs with a foot sweep. BERNARD crashes down. Then from behind ANGEL.

dialogues.speaker: REV. SHOOTER
dialogues.text: STOP! STOP THIS! Please. Let us put down our guns. Nicholas, my son, you may not be a man of god but surely you’re a man of peace.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Reverend I may not be convinced about the existence of God but I know good and evil and I have the grace to know which is which.

dialogues.speaker: REV. SHOOTER
dialogues.text: Oh fuck off Grasshopper! REV. SHOOTER pulls a pistol from his cassock and fires. T bullet takes ANGEL by surprise, grazing his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Noooooooo00! DANNY returns fire at SHOOTER hitting him in the shoulder  132.

dialogues.speaker: REV. SHOOTER
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!!! DANNY runs over to ANGEL who is lying winded in the road.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Still feel like you’re missing out? CLICK. They turn to see DR. HATCHER pointing a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HATCHER
dialogues.text: Drop your weapons.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Dr. Hatcher wait.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HATCHER
dialogues.text: Shut up Danny. I brought you into this world, it’s rather fitting I should be the one to take you out of it. You and your interfering little friend. Now drop them! DANNY does so. His shotgun hits the [U+FBO2]oor. BLAM! It fires into HATCHER’s leg. His knee explodes in a shower o blood. DR. HATCHER clutches his knee, wailing in pain.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: You’re a doctor, deal with it...motherfucker. Danny, let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What are you thinking exactly? A shot blasts from the windows of THE CROWN.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Pub? ANGEL eyes the board outside the pub; reading ’COME ON IN

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. THE CROWN
dialogues.text: SMASH. The pub board comes smashing through the window. The PORTERS fire wildly from behind the bar, before a sig reading ’TWO SHOOTERS FOR THE PRICE OF ONE’. They stop. Then - the pub doors [U+FB02]y open. DANNY and ANGEL burs in, jumping through the air whilst both firing two guns.  133. They land and roll, grabbing tables to form a barricade. PORTERS open fire again. Tables and chairs splinter. ANGEL pops up and fires at a bear trap on the wall. It fa and clamps its jaws around ROY PORTER’s head.

dialogues.speaker: MARY PORTER
dialogues.text: Roy! Somebody call the police!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Reach! The entire Sandford police burst in, wearing RIOT GEAR an clutching batons. WALKER holds a growling SAXON on a leas FRANK leads them, aiming his ANTIQUE PISTOLS at ANGEL. FRANK (CONT’D} Officers, arrest that man. Danny, step away from the Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: No Dad.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Danny, you’1l do as you’re told.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: No, I’m not taking orders from you any more.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Officers, arrest these men!

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: You can arrest us if you want. You can throw us in prison and go back to being blind, submissive slaves.

dialogues.speaker: CARTWRIGHT
dialogues.text: What the fuck is he on about?

dialogues.speaker: WAINWRIGHT
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you on about?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Have you ever wondered why the crime rate in Sandford is so low and the accident rate so high?

dialogues.speaker: FISHER
dialogues.text: No. Yes. What?  134.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: You’ve been brain washed Sergeant into naivety by an old man with a murderous obsession and it’s time you opened your eyes to the truth.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: No, it’s not Dad. It’s very unridiculous. And it’s only now that I’m starting to realise how unridiculous it all is.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Silence Danny! Think of your mother.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Mum’s dead and for the first time in my life, I’m glad. Because even though she loved this village more than anything if she could see what you’ve become, she’d kill herself all over again.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS THATCHER
dialogues.text: Sorry, I’m completely lost.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Sandford is a lie Doris. For the last twenty years the village has been controlled by Frank and the NWA. They’ve lulled you into thinking this is a perfect village by killing anyone who threatened to change that. SAXON stops growling. BOB WALKER pipes up.

dialogues.speaker: WALKER
dialogues.text: Recconneeegottsumadere.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: He says he ‘’reckons you got something there’.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I know. Thanks.  135.

dialogues.speaker: WALKER/DANNY
dialogues.text: S’alroight. FRANK rounds on the officers, raising his pistols at them

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You’re not seriously going to believe this man are you? Are you?! He’s not even from round here. The officers look on in confused disbelief at the manic FRANK, who realises he is brandishing his weapons.

dialogues.speaker: WAINWRIGHT
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s time to give it up sir.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You ignorant flatfoots! FRANK snaps, shooting his pistols up in the air. He hits rustic light fitting, which crashes to the ground. ANGEL and the other officers dive out of the way, as glas explodes across the main bar. Everyone scatters. In the confusion, FRANK makes a bid for freedom through t back of the pub. ANGEL jumps up. The other officers stare after FRANK, then look to ANGEL, their new leader.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Aren’t we gonna go after dad?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: He’11 come round again.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Well, who else is there?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Want anything from the shop? FLASHCUTS; the police tool up, cuff people. PC WALKER and SAXON guard the already incapacitated NWA members. ROY PORTER still has the bear trap on his head.  136.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGEL leads his new recruits as they approach the car par They take cover behind recycling bins, armed and ready.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What you thinking? Before Angel can answer-

dialogues.speaker: FISHR
dialogues.text: We should strike now while we have the element of surprise, the longer we wait the more time they have to mobilise. I say we go in through the front entrance and take the place aisle by aisle. They won’t be expecting that.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Very good. What he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grim SKINNER and his gormless minions watch the CCTV.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNER
dialogues.text: My, my. Here come the fuzz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sandford police gather near the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: WAINWRIGHT
dialogues.text: Maybe they’re not in.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Wait here. ANGEL goes into SUMMERAISLES through the automatic door.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS THATCHER
dialogues.text: We can’t let him go in on his own.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: He knows what he’s doing. KRAAASSSHHHH! ANGEL comes [U+FB02]ying through the front window of the shop and lands in a heap on the ground. He gets up.  137.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: They’re in. You take the shop. I’1l deal with the trolley boy.

dialogues.speaker: WAINWRIGHT CARTWRIGHT
dialogues.text: Eh? Eh? LURCH strides out of the shop.

dialogues.speaker: WAINWRIGHT CARTWRIGHT
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh. DANNY leads the officers in, as ANGEL faces up to LURCH. ANGEL (cont’d) We don’t have to do this Michael. Is this what you really want?

dialogues.speaker: LURCH
dialogues.text: Yarp.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. ANGEL runs at LUNCH and headbutts him in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OFFICERS make their way through the supermarket aisle WAINWRIGHT peers round a corner. One of the GRUFF BUTCHER throws a large meat cleaver. It shatters a tomato sauce j next to his head. CARTWRIGHT shrieks, assuming it’s blood

dialogues.speaker: CARTWRIGHT
dialogues.text: Andy! Meanwhile ANGEL is being swung around by LURCH, his arms clamped tightly around LURCH’s neck. ANGEL [U+FB02]ailing legs knock produce off shelves as he clings on tight. LUR begins to lose consciousness. He staggers past a ‘’WET FL sign, slips and both fall hard into a chest freezer. ANGEL scrambles out covered in frost. LURCH is out cold. ANGEL joins the other officers, who crouch behind shelves they shoot at the two GRUEE EUTCHERS.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Where’s Lurch?  138.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: He’s unconscious in the freezer.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Did you say ‘cool off’?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: No I didn’t say anything.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Oh shame.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: But you missed a bit earlier when I distracted him with the monkey, said ’Playtime’s over’ and hit him with the Peace Lily.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You’re off the fucking chain! Another cleaver whizzes by, smashing more sauce bottles.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: What’s the situation?

dialogues.speaker: WAINWRIGHT
dialogues.text: Two blokes and a lot of cutlery. What do you reckon? The two GRUFF BUTCHERS wait, knives drawn, ready to throw Suddenly a terrific clattering rumble fills the store. A battering ram comprised of several trollies handcuffed together bursts into view, hurtling toward the GRUFF BUTCHERS. The ANDES ride the front of the trolley-ram, yelling like Vikings. The trollies crash into the meat counter, knocking the GR BUTCHERS to the [U+FB02]o0or. The ANDES leap off the make battering ram and deck the [U+FB02]oored bad guys. A PIERCING SCREAM. The officers turn to see the sluttish CHECKOUT GIRL running towards them. DORIS THATCHER grabs the ’WET FLOOR’ sign and slams it in the CHECKOUT GIRL’s face. She slides across the [U+FBO2]o WAINWRIGHT (cont’d) Nice one Doris.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS THATCHER
dialogues.text: Nothing like a bit of girl on girl.  139. SPLAT! The officers duck for cover. Gangly SHELF STACKERS appear, throwing a volley of melons and pineapples.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Can you handle this sergeant? We’re going after the big boss.

dialogues.speaker: FISHER
dialogues.text: We’re on it, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Danny, let’s roll.

dialogues.speaker: WAINWEIGHT
dialogues.text: Angel! Don’t go being a twat now.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t give you the satisfaction. ANGEL and DANNY burst in. The office is deserted, the win open. They see SKINNER in the car park climbing into a SQ CAR, driven by FRANK. ANGEL (cont’d) Let’s get down there.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Skip. ANGEL and DANNY jump through the open window and land ina skip full of cardboard boxes, as FRANK’s car peels off. ANGEL (cont’d) Head ’em off?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah. ANGEL and DANNY sprint down an alley, burst back into the square and race towards DANNY’s SQUAD CAR. DANNY (cont’d) I'll drive. ANGEL slides over the bonnet to the passenger side. FRANK car screams past. DANNY gets in and [U+FBO2]icks on the siren.  140.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Punch that shit! They screech off. Behind them we see the once picturesque square bullet riddled and blood splattered. The banner reading ‘Village of the Year’ [U+FBO2]utters to the groun Three official looking types holding clipboards stand gobsmacked amid the debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK’s car races past a ’KILL YOUR SPEED’ sign. Behind, ANGEL and DANNY gain on them. They take turns shooting at FRANK’s car as they go. It’s COP ON COP. FRANK’s car hits the brow of a hill at 100mph and gets ai As it hits the road again, SKINNNR spots something.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNER
dialogues.text: Swan! FRANK panics. Swerves. Big mistake. The car careers off t road and smashes right into a sign for the ’MODEL VILLAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful blue sky. The sun beams down on a perfect vis of Sandford. The idyllic shot is quickly ruined however a A GIGANTIC SQUAD CAR [U+FB02]ies over what we reveal to b miniature version of Sandford. A small GINGER HAIRED KID stares in awe as the SQUAD CAR brie[U+FB02]y blocks out t sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGEL and DANNY’s SQUAD CAR reaches the brow of the hill.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Swan. DANNY brakes with expert timing. They screech to a stop b the waddling SWAN. ANGEL opens the door and grabs the SWA  141.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAN now sat in the back seat, DANNY takes the SQUAD into the Model Village. Ahead is a scene of devastation. FRANK’s SQUAD CAR lies upturned in a water feature, a damaged sprinkler rains water down onto the model village FRANK is motionless at the wheel. SKINNER limps away from the crash. ANGEL jumps from the c and runs toward him. DANNY runs over to his injured fathe SKINNER swipes up the GINGER HAIRED KID and holds a pisto to his head. ANGEL freezes, stopping dead in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: SKTNNER
dialogues.text: Stay back or the ginger nut gets it! The KID thinks fast, sinking his teeth into SKINNER’s han

dialogues.speaker: SKINNER
dialogues.text: Ow you little fucker! SKINNER drops the kid. Before he has a chance to recover, ANGEL pounces and they both crash down into the tiny village. SKINNER’s pistol skitters down a miniature stree ANGEL and SKINNER spring back up. The sprinkler rains dow as they trade blows. The low angle in the model village makes them look like GODZILLA and KING KONG. ANGEL hits SKINNER twice hard in the face. Reaching out SKINNER grabs ANGELS’s hand. ANGEL winces in pain. SKINNE sees he has discovered a weakness and exploits it. He twi ANGEL’s hand whilst raining blows down on his face. SKINNER (cont’d)

dialogues.speaker: GET GUT GE MY VILLAGE
dialogues.text: ANGEL straightens himself like T2 and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: It’s not your village any more. WHAM. ANGEL [U+FBO2]attens SKINNER with one punch. SKINNE sprawls across a mini village sguare. ANGEL looks over to the GINGER KID, who is agog at the coolness of events. ANGEL (cont’d) Well done son. What’s your name?  142.

dialogues.speaker: GINGER HAIRED KID
dialogues.text: Aaron A. Aaronson.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry? The KID’s eyes go wide. ANGEL spins around. Behind is a Maniacal SKINNER, holding a box cutter knife and running full pelt at ANGEL through the tiny streets.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNER
dialogues.text: Annnnnnnnnnnnnngell1111111! SKINNER trips on a model Someraisles truck. His legs slip from under him, sending him [U+FB02]ying. He spins in the air. SPLAT. SKINNER falls hard onto the miniature church roof. model turret has embedded itself beneath SKINNER’s chin a protrudes through his mouth. ANGEL looks to DANNY who pulls FRANK from the SQUAD CAR.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Danny. It’s over.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNER
dialogues.text: Ooowwww . SKINNER is not actually dead. He speaks, even though his neck and tongue are now pierced by the turret.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNER
dialogues.text: Goooow, thith weally hurth. I can’t feel my thongue. I’m going to need thome ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: There’s plenty of ice cream back at the station. Isn’t there- ANGEL turns to see FRANK holding a gun to DANNY’s head. ANGEL (cont’d) Oh pack it in Frank, you silly bastard!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Now, now Sergeant. We don’t want any more bloodshed.  143.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Dad, don’t do this!

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Frank, this whole thing started because you lost someone you loved. Don’t expect me to believe you’d let it end the same way.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’11 tell you how this is going to end! He points his gun at ANGEL. DANNY leaps on FRANK wrestlin the gun from him. FRANK sprints off towards ANGEL’s car. DANNY aims the gun at him and is about to pull the trigge He can’t. Instead he points the gun in the air and fires.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Aaaaargh! FRANK jumps in the car and peels off, wheels screeching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK looks in his rear view. No one pursues him. However he is not alone in the car. Behind, the long slen neck of THE SWAN rears up. FRANK turns. It pounces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGEL and DANNY watch as the CAR veers wildly and crashes into a tree. We hear the sound of distant swan battle.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I feel like I should say something smart.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You don’t have to say anything at all. Rehind them cars screech up and the rest of the Sandford police run over. The two officers look up to see a METROPOLITAN POLICE HELICOPTER coming to land in a field.  144.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK sits handcuffed in the back of an ambulance, wearin neckbrace. SKINNER is carried through shot on a stretcher, the model church spire still sticking through his face. The HOODIES record this sight on their mobiles.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNER
dialogues.text: Ow ow Ow Ow Ow Ow ow. We see the Swan cuffed to a car door by the neck. The OLD MAN IN A CAP approaches to retrieve him. ANGEL and DANNY sit with blankets around them. They are addressed by the three ofificers from the start of the fi

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: What do you say Nicholas?

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: We’ve been trying to reach you for days.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Well I’ve been kind of busy.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: We need you back. The figures have gone a little squiffy in your absence it has to be said.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: Come back to London. Sandford’s hardly fitting for such an exceptional officer. ANGEL looks to DANNY, then back at the model Sandford.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Yes, but the thing is sir. I like it here. Now, if you’1l excuse me, we have to do a considerable amount of paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. STATION
dialogues.text: FASTCUTS of forms being filled, various NWA members processed; prints, mug shots etc. ROY PORTER still has th bear trap on his head. He is measured as 7 feet 5 inches.  145.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire Sandford force, including both DESK SERGEANTS guietly scribbling away. DANNY is particularly hard at wo the Peace Lily now has pride of place on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: WATNWRIGHT
dialogues.text: Fucking hell Nick, this is going to take ages.

dialogues.speaker: CARTWRIGHT
dialogues.text: Yeah, we’re gonna be here all night.

dialogues.speaker: FISHER
dialogues.text: Good job we’ve got the manpower isn’t it Andy?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Actually, official vocab guidelines state that we say ‘staf [U+FB02]ng’, not ‘manpower’. ‘Manpower’s sexist.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: You don’t mind a bit of manpower do you Doris?

dialogues.speaker: DORIS THATCHER
dialogues.text: Dirty bastard! Everyone laughs. Whoops and catcalls fill the office. ANG is for once the office joker. A WASTEPAPER BASKET hits him hard on the head.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Hey you cheeky fucker! Another huge laugh. ANGEL grins at DANNY, who appears suddenly grave. He follows DANNY’s gaze to see TOM WEAVER Aiming a BLUNDERBUSS at ANGEL, his face full of hate.

dialogues.speaker: WEAVER
dialogues.text: You know what you are? A bloody busy -body! WEAVER fires. DANNY lunges at ANGEL, pushing him off his chair and taking full force of WEAVER’s blast in the ches With lightning speed ANGEL slips his feet into a wastepap basket and kicks it at WEAVER’s face.  146. WEAVER staggers back into the evidence ream. He hits the back shelf. The sea mine teeters, rolls forward and drops between WEAVER’s legs, narrowly missing his crotch. WEAVER (cont’d) Oh thank god. KA-BOOM. The sea mine gees off. The evidence room door blasts outwards. ANGEL [U+FB02]ies backwards thrcugh the SANDFORD POLICE STATION EXPLODES. In the clearing smoke, paperwork [U+FBO2]utters to the fi From under the rubble, we see movement. A hedgehog crawls out, blinking in the light. Then the Sandford Police Service, blackened but intact, miraoulcusly get to their feet. A frantic ANGEL hurries o to find DANNY who lies among the debris, barely alive.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Hold an Danny. Everything’s alright. The offieers gather round ANGEL cradling DANNY in his arm ANGEL (cont’d) Everything’s gonna be just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTION - ’One Year Later’. We see ANGEL leaving a cottag and walk by a garden yath. We see ANGEL, now an Inspector, suiting up at the station His uniform is different however. It’s more modern. Coole He is else armed with an automatic revolver. ANGEL strolls down a station corridor. Familiar looking brightly coloured notices are pinned all around the walls ANGEL walks out of the newly built station, and gets into his new SQUAD CAR. It’s mere modern. Cooler. ANGEL drives along, his passenger seat conspicuously empt He passes a skate yark where GABRIEL WEAVER and friends congregate, their heeds down. His mobile rings. He answer

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Okay. Give me a minute. ANGEL comes out of the florists, now called LESLIE’S GARD with a bouquet of [U+FBO2]owers and gets into his car.  147. He walks through the graveyard to a single headstone. We that it reads BUTTERMAN. ANGEL (CONT’D) Are these okay?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah they’re lovely. DANNY is revealed, standing next to ANGEL. He kneels down and places the [U+FBO2]owers on a grave. ANGEL steps back revealing the full headstone. It reads, ‘IRENE BUTTERMAN’

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. SQUAD CAR
dialogues.text: DANNY and ANGEL are in their car. The radic crackles.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS THATCHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Any officers near the church?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Go ahead Doris.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS TRATCHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Chief, we’ve had a report of some hippy types messin’ with the recycle bins at the supermarket.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Leave it with us. Sergeant Butterman. Little hand says it’s time to rock and roll.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Bring the noise. We cut to the exterior of the SQUAD CAR. ANGEL pulls a spectacular handbrake turn, spinning the car 180 degrees. Accelerating with a roar, the car hurtles towards us, filling the frame.
